TI: A journey from neocortex to hippocampus.
AB: In the mid-1960s, it was generally agreed that the engram, the neural trace of previously experienced events, must be encoded by Hebb-like neurons in which synaptic efficacy could be modified by activity. Here, I describe my attempts as a PhD student at McGill University, Montreal, to find rules governing cortical plasticity in the neocortex, and having failed, why the hippocampus seemed to offer a far better prospect.
AD: Division of Neurophysiology, National Institute for Medical Research, Mill Hill, London NW7 1AA, UK. tbliss@nimr.mrc.ac.uk
TA: Philos Trans R Soc Lond B Biol Sci
JT: Philosophical transactions of the Royal Society of London. Series B, Biological sciences
SO: Philos Trans R Soc Lond B Biol Sci. 2003 Apr 29;358(1432):621-3. doi: 10.1098/rstb.2002.1227.
